crypto.name: HangmanBattleRoyale
crypto.desc: Can you win at least 8 rounds of Hangman?

crypto.name: Hashcrack101
crypto.desc: I've got some simple hashes for you to crack. To get your flag, concatenate the plaintext of each hash with underscores and surround in CTF{}. For example, CTF{plaintext01_plaintext02}.

crypto.name: Xoray
crypto.desc: Peer beyond the encryption to the hidden structure!

pwn.name: GlitterPrinter
pwn.desc: We dumped the attached blob from a 'printer'. Can you figure out how to get the flag? We're pretty sure it's x86, and it looks like the code might be loaded into RWX memory?

pwn.name: LogThemAll
pwn.desc: Play to win and log 'em all! Once you've seen all 151 Asciimon, talk to Professor Jack for the flag. We've included some data for the first couple rooms, you'll have to figure out the rest yourself!

pwn.name: Pwnzoo
pwn.desc: We have a very basic zoo here -- can you pwn it?

pwn.name: Reverseme
pwn.desc: This is like runme, but with a twist! Can you figure out what it is?

pwn.name: Reverseme2
pwn.desc: This is like runme, but with a twist! Can you figure out what it is?

pwn.name: Ropme
pwn.desc: Can you bounce your way to victory? (Note: this is 32-bit x86, and much, much harder than runme)

pwn.name: Runme
pwn.desc:
You send x64 code, we run it! Try:

echo -ne '\xe8\x0d\x00\x00\x00\x48\x65\x6c\x6c\x6f\x20\x77\x6f\x72\x6c\x64\x0a\x00\x5e\x48\x31\xc0\x48\xff\xc0\x48\x31\xff\x48\xff\xc6\x48\x31\xd2\xb2\x0c\x0f\x05\x48\x31\xc0\xb0\x3c\x48\x31\xff\x0f\x05' | nc -v runme-bc63cb99.challenges.bsidessf.net 1337

pwn.name: Runme2
pwn.desc: You send x64 code, we run it! No NULL bytes, this time.

pwn.name: Runme3
pwn.desc: You send x64 code, we run it! No NULL bytes, still. Also, no 0xCD, 0x80, 0x0F, or 0x05. That means no int 0x80, and no syscall. Have fun!

pwn.name: SecureAssetManager
pwn.desc: This tool logs into a server. We think there's a flag hiding there. Can you figure out how the tool works and get the flag?

rev.name: ChargeTracker
rev.desc: Check your battery status with this new App

rev.name: GreatKeyHunt
rev.desc: We've found an encrypted flag, but the encrypter crashed and left us a core file -- can you use that to find the flag?

rev.name: Keygenme
rev.desc: Many of us got started in reversing by doing keygens. I thought I'd throw something together to introduce keygens and maybe take some of us back in time. Enjoy the theme.

rev.name: MessageStore
rev.desc: Can you view the admin's message?

rev.name: Relaunch
rev.desc: Can you find the secret code to relaunch the missiles?
